# Badge

import { DarkModeCompatible } from '@site/src/components/DarkModeCompatible';

<DarkModeCompatible />

Compact label component for tags, statuses, and counters. Supports multiple color variants, sizes, dots, and pill shape.

## Overview

Use `Badge` when you need…

- A compact label for status, category, or count
- Color variants via `variant`
- Sizes via `size`
- A dot indicator via `dot`
- A pill shape via `rounded`

## Live Demo

<LiveDemo />

## Import

```tsx
import { Badge } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';
```

## Basic Usage

```tsx
<Badge variant="primary">New</Badge>

<Badge variant="success" dot rounded>
  Synced
</Badge>
```

## Anatomy

The Badge component consists of several key parts:

```
┌─────────────────────────┐
│  [●] Label              │  ← Badge Container
└─────────────────────────┘
    ↑    ↑
    │    └─ Required text content
    └────── Optional dot indicator
```

**Component Structure:**

- **Container**: Handles layout, padding, colors, and border radius
- **Dot Indicator** (optional): Small circular indicator before the label
- **Label**: The main text content (supports any ReactNode)

**Visual States:**

- **Default**: Normal static state (badges are non-interactive)
- **Variant**: Color scheme determined by variant prop (default, primary, success, warning, danger, info)
- **Size**: Compact (sm), default (md), or large (lg)
- **Shape**: Standard rounded corners or pill-shaped (fully rounded)

## API Reference

### Props

| Prop       | Type                                                                     | Default     | Description                     |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ----------- | ------------------------------- |
| `children` | `ReactNode`                                                              | -           | Badge content                   |
| `label`    | `string`                                                                 | -           | **Deprecated** (use `children`) |
| `size`     | `'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg'`                                                   | `'md'`      | Badge size                      |
| `variant`  | `'default' \| 'primary' \| 'success' \| 'warning' \| 'danger' \| 'info'` | `'default'` | Color variant                   |
| `dot`      | `boolean`                                                                | `false`     | Shows a dot indicator           |
| `rounded`  | `boolean`                                                                | `false`     | Makes the badge pill-shaped     |

Also supports all standard HTML `span` attributes (e.g., `className`, `style`, `aria-label`, `data-*`).

### Variant Details

Each variant maps to semantic design tokens:

- **default**: Neutral gray, for general labels and tags
- **primary**: Main brand color, for primary status or emphasis
- **success**: Positive status (e.g., "Active", "Completed", "Online")
- **warning**: Cautionary status (e.g., "Pending", "In Progress")
- **danger**: Critical status (e.g., "Error", "Failed", "Offline")
- **info**: Informational status (e.g., "New", "Beta", "Updated")

### Size Details

- **sm**: Compact size for dense interfaces (20px height)
- **md**: Default size for most use cases (24px height)
- **lg**: Larger size for prominent labels (28px height)

## Best Practices

### Do ✅

- Keep labels short and scannable (1–2 words)
- Use `dot` for status indicators where the color reinforces meaning
- Use `rounded` for pill-like tags, filters, or counters

### Don't ❌

- Don’t rely on color alone for critical meaning; include text when it matters
- Don’t use badges for long sentences; prefer a `Typography` block or callout

## Accessibility

The Badge component is designed with WCAG 2.1 AA compliance in mind:

### Keyboard Navigation

Badges are non-interactive by default and do not receive keyboard focus. If you need a clickable badge:

- Wrap the badge in a `<button>` or `<a>` element
- Ensure the interactive element has proper focus indicators
- Use appropriate ARIA attributes for the action

### Screen Reader Support

**For Status Badges:**

```tsx
<Badge variant="success">Active</Badge>
// Screen reader announces: "Active"
```

**For Notification Count:**

```tsx
<Badge variant="danger">3</Badge>
// For notifications, add context:
<Badge variant="danger" aria-label="3 unread notifications">3</Badge>
// Screen reader announces: "3 unread notifications"
```

**For Decorative Badges:**

```tsx
<Badge variant="info" aria-hidden="true">
  New
</Badge>
// If badge is purely decorative and duplicates nearby text
```

### Best Practices for Accessibility

#### Do ✅

- Keep labels short and scannable (1-2 words)
- Use `aria-label` to provide context for counts or icons
- Combine color with text (don't rely on color alone)
- Ensure badges are used as labels, not interactive elements
- Use semantic variants that match the meaning (success for positive, danger for negative)

#### Don't ❌

- Don't rely on color alone for critical meaning; include descriptive text
- Don't use badges for long sentences; prefer Typography or callout components
- Don't make badges interactive without proper button/link semantics
- Don't use `dot` as the only state indicator; pair with text
- Don't use low-contrast custom colors that fail WCAG guidelines

### ARIA Attributes

The component supports standard ARIA attributes passed as props:

```tsx
<Badge variant="danger" aria-label="5 errors">
  5
</Badge>

<Badge variant="success" role="status" aria-live="polite">
  Synced
</Badge>
```

Common ARIA attributes for badges:

- `aria-label`: Provide full description for counts or abbreviations
- `aria-hidden="true"`: Hide decorative badges from screen readers
- `role="status"`: For dynamic status updates
- `aria-live="polite"`: Announce changes to badge content

### Color Contrast

All badge variants meet WCAG 2.1 AA contrast requirements:

- Badge text: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio against background
- Badge background: Minimum 3:1 contrast ratio against page background
- Dot indicator: Matches badge background color for consistency

Tested in both light and dark modes.

## Common Patterns

### Notification Badge

```tsx title="src/components/NotificationIcon.tsx"
import { Badge } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function NotificationIcon() {
  const unreadCount = 5;

  return (
    <div style={{ position: 'relative', display: 'inline-block' }}>
      <BellIcon />
      {unreadCount > 0 && (
        <Badge
          variant="danger"
          size="sm"
          rounded
          aria-label={`${unreadCount} unread notifications`}
          style={{ position: 'absolute', top: -8, right: -8 }}
        >
          {unreadCount}
        </Badge>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Status Badge

```tsx title="src/components/UserStatus.tsx"
import { Badge } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function UserStatus({ status }: { status: 'online' | 'offline' | 'away' }) {
  const statusConfig = {
    online: { variant: 'success' as const, label: 'Online' },
    offline: { variant: 'default' as const, label: 'Offline' },
    away: { variant: 'warning' as const, label: 'Away' },
  };

  const { variant, label } = statusConfig[status];

  return (
    <Badge variant={variant} dot rounded>
      {label}
    </Badge>
  );
}
```

### Count Badge

```tsx title="src/components/CartIcon.tsx"
import { Badge } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function CartIcon() {
  const itemCount = 3;

  return (
    <button aria-label={`Shopping cart with ${itemCount} items`}>
      <ShoppingCartIcon />
      {itemCount > 0 && (
        <Badge variant="primary" size="sm" rounded>
          {itemCount > 99 ? '99+' : itemCount}
        </Badge>
      )}
    </button>
  );
}
```

### Badge on Avatar

```tsx title="src/components/UserAvatar.tsx"
import { Badge } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function UserAvatar({ name, isOnline }: { name: string; isOnline: boolean }) {
  return (
    <div style={{ position: 'relative', display: 'inline-block' }}>
      <img src="/avatar.jpg" alt={name} style={{ borderRadius: '50%' }} />
      <Badge
        variant={isOnline ? 'success' : 'default'}
        dot
        aria-label={isOnline ? 'Online' : 'Offline'}
        style={{
          position: 'absolute',
          bottom: 0,
          right: 0,
          border: '2px solid white',
        }}
      />
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Category Tags

```tsx title="src/components/ArticleTags.tsx"
import { Badge, Stack } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function ArticleTags({ tags }: { tags: string[] }) {
  return (
    <Stack direction="row" spacing="small" wrap>
      {tags.map((tag) => (
        <Badge key={tag} variant="default" rounded>
          {tag}
        </Badge>
      ))}
    </Stack>
  );
}

// Usage:
<ArticleTags tags={['React', 'TypeScript', 'Design System']} />;
```

### Dynamic Status List

```tsx title="src/components/ServiceStatus.tsx"
import { Badge } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function ServiceStatus() {
  const services = [
    { name: 'API Server', status: 'operational' },
    { name: 'Database', status: 'operational' },
    { name: 'Cache', status: 'degraded' },
    { name: 'Storage', status: 'down' },
  ];

  const getVariant = (status: string) => {
    switch (status) {
      case 'operational':
        return 'success' as const;
      case 'degraded':
        return 'warning' as const;
      case 'down':
        return 'danger' as const;
      default:
        return 'default' as const;
    }
  };

  return (
    <ul>
      {services.map((service) => (
        <li key={service.name}>
          <Badge variant={getVariant(service.status)} dot>
            {service.name}
          </Badge>
          : {service.status}
        </li>
      ))}
    </ul>
  );
}
```

### Feature Badge

```tsx title="src/components/FeatureCard.tsx"
import { Badge } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function FeatureCard({ title, isNew, isBeta }: { title: string; isNew?: boolean; isBeta?: boolean }) {
  return (
    <div>
      <h3>
        {title}
        {isNew && (
          <Badge variant="info" size="sm" rounded style={{ marginLeft: 8 }}>
            New
          </Badge>
        )}
        {isBeta && (
          <Badge variant="warning" size="sm" rounded style={{ marginLeft: 8 }}>
            Beta
          </Badge>
        )}
      </h3>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## TypeScript Support

The Badge component is fully typed with TypeScript:

```tsx
import type { HTMLAttributes, ReactNode } from 'react';

export type BadgeProps = {
  children?: ReactNode;
  label?: string; // Deprecated
  size?: 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg';
  variant?: 'default' | 'primary' | 'success' | 'warning' | 'danger' | 'info';
  dot?: boolean;
  rounded?: boolean;
} & HTMLAttributes<HTMLSpanElement>;
```

This ensures type safety and autocomplete in your IDE.
